intro: Calcearia solomonensis, commonly known as the Solomon Islands starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Calcearia solomonensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
